newsitem.title: UK: SmithKline Beecham to close Singapore plant.
newsitem.headline: SmithKline Beecham to close Singapore plant.

text.p: Drugs giant SmithKline Beecham Plc said on Thursday that it was to close a consumer healthcare manufacturing plant in Singapore with the loss of 130 jobs.

A spokesman said the factory made a variety of products, including Lucozade, Ribena and Horlicks health drinks. Production would be shifted to the U.K. and Malaysia, with the closure expected to be completed in the next nine months.

The company said the closure was part of a worldwide reorganisation of its manufacturing operations aimed at making them more competitive. The group also has a pharmaceutical manufacturing plant in Singapore.
